org.qbroker.jms

Class MessageFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qbroker.jms.MessageFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Filter<javax.jms.Message>

    public class MessageFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Filter<javax.jms.Message>
    MessageFilter is a client side filter with an internal formatter. The method of evaluate() returns true if the filter matches the message. Otherwise, it returns false. The method of format is to format the message with the internal formatter. To skip loading the internal formatter, please make sure ClassName defined.

    As to formatter, you can define TemplateMap and/or SubstitutionMap in the property Map. It will update the maps and try to reuse the objects already created.
    Author:
    yannanlu@yahoo.com

        public boolean evaluate(long tm,

        Description copied from interface: Filter

        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface Filter<javax.jms.Message>

      • evaluate

        public boolean evaluate(javax.jms.Message message,
               java.lang.String msgStr)
                 throws javax.jms.JMSException
        It applies the Perl5 pattern match on the message and returns true if the filter gets a hit or false otherwise. In case there are patterns for message body, it requires the content of the message body ready.
        Throws:
        javax.jms.JMSException

      • evaluate

        public boolean evaluate(java.lang.String msgStr)
        evaluates the msgStr as the message body only
